name: Reina
Weyland Quick Money Advance
description:
I built this originally as a GRNDL Quick Money Advance deck before realizing GRNDL wasn't legal yet. Whoops.

Well, looking at the deck, the idea is obvious. Drop down cheap ice, score money agendas quick, take all the bad publicity.. cause it really doesn't matter. Try to trick them with a late archer or grim to disrupt.

RSVP is the all-star.

name: Kit Attack v1.4
description: A couple of changes here. I removed chakana, I really liked the idea but I needed some card draw boost. In its place I added some diesel, you can't go wrong with diesel. Also, I found out that emergency shutdown was't that good in a deck that doesn't have a lot of incentive to run HQ, so I removed it and added 2 parasites and a ninja. The ninja I added because I needed a cheaper sentry breaker. I added Ninja and not Mimic because ninja, hosted in the Dino, can kill an archer with 7$. I'm thinking of adding Garrote but the 3 influence is a problem. The parasites are a lot of fun to use with shapers. Even without parasites, I can leave them on an annoying piece of ice and even kill a couple outright, even in the middle of a run. Lastly I removed an R&D interface and added a third Scavenge. This is the only change I'm still not very sure about. I felt that I needed some more scavenges, both for redirecting Femme and Cybercyfers and to test run-scavenge Torch. I'll see how that goes.

name: OCTGN test deck- Criminal
OCTGN test deck- Criminal
Death by a thousand net damage. v1.2
description: Ok, some rethinks and changes. First of all, I removed the wotan and ichi 2.0 for a third archer and two sansan city grid. My idea for this was that I prefer that I score the agenda in the same turn that I draw it. This also means that there is higher danger for HQ runs now and this is why I added both eli and a 3rd archer. Hokusai city grid is still one of the most useful cards in here and it can be a pain to eat one in the face as you try to access a card from HQ. I removed project junebag and added shock, I find it far more useful since it can do damage from both r&d and HQ. It has a trash cost so it won't go away if accessed from both this locations witch is an added bonus. I swapped swordsman for a Tsurugi, if I find that AIs are such a big problem again I'll swap them back again, but I think that my Ice str disparity is adequate. The swap of two unorthodox predictions for a braintrust was a must since I needed the extra card, If I find it problematic I'll bring them back and I might remove something else. Last I removed the hedge fund for the celebrity gift because I feel that later game intimidation and better profit is preferable to first turn boost. If it doesn't work I'll swap them back in again.

name: Crimson King v1.0
Whizzing through the Keyhole
description: This is a deck inspired by the recent "Through the Keyhole" builds by HepatitvusJ and the discussion on them. It's just my take on the subject. I tried to make the economy as little click-based as possible. the only concession being the 2 Liberated Accounts, used for ramping up (install, click, click, click). I also prefer Darwin to Crypsis, especially with Surges (which can also boost the Parasites). I may revert to running Djinns to tutor up Darwins and, more importantly, Parasites, but I'm not sure what to take out for them. Anyway, your comments are appreciated.

name: HighWalls  ver 1.0
Through the Keyhole 2.5
description: My most recent build for Through the Keyhole with modifications based on comments in my 1.5 and 2.0 builds. Thanks everyone for your suggestions. :) I've gone with lawyer up for the draw (because of its other benefits) but I'm keeping 3 quality time with the deck to test which works better. Tempo wise, quality time will almost always be better. Lawyer up beats quality time in only a few instances and that's following an account siphon, data raven runs, mid seasons, etc. All of these triggers are common enough to warrant lawyer up imo. Only testing will tell for sure.

name: Sting (Like an Industrial Bee) v1.3.1
description:
-2 Commercialization, +2 Power Grid Overload

This is a tweak to counter Plasteel Carapaces

name: Weyland
Jinteki fast advance
Reina Beta Test 1.2
description: Have always ran Noise and wanted to stay with Anarchs. Wanted to be able to cause the corp to pay more to rez ice and me to pay less to go through it. Still debating between Grimoire and Deep Red for my console. Any comments are welcome.

Net Police: Jackson Howard Cyberdex trial: restructure

name: Siberia 1.0
description: Heavy Ice focused HB-ND deck. Fast Advancing / Burst Economy

name: Wide Awake
description:
Cheat out as much big ICE as you can, and score behind them if you can, or make the runner broke so you can score.

Ideally you want 8 cost or less Bioroids on Awakening Center, so it is almost free to rez. Can use interns to put ice back onto awakening center, or onto a server once you have credits or OAI or BER.

Almost always use ABT, since if you hit some ice they will most likely be big ones. Live dangerously =)

name: Replicandy
description: for Marc

name: Haas-Bioroid econ/ice deck
description: My first try at deckbuilding. I'm hoping that high econ cards will help build some strong ice walls.

name: Replicating death ver 2.0
description: revised 45 card deck version. All 3 point agendas other than fetal and reduced jackson howard to add two pop up windows. Will test out the deck but I'm thinking fitting in ronin somewhere would be beneficial but not sure what to take out at the moment.
